title: Vectors of Trust (VoT) - RFC 8485
description: Vector of Trust definitions based on RFC 8485 (https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc8485.html)

P0.name: No Proofing
P0.description: No proofing is done, and data is not guaranteed to be persistent across sessions

P1.name: Self-Asserted
P1.description: Attributes are self-asserted but consistent over time, potentially pseudonymous

P2.name: Trusted Mechanisms
P2.description: Identity has been proofed either in person or remotely using trusted mechanisms (such as social proofing)

P3.name: Binding Relationship
P3.description: There is a binding relationship between the identity provider and the identified party (such as signed/notarized documents and employment records)

C0.name: No Credential
C0.description: No credential is used / anonymous public service

Ca.name: Session Cookies
Ca.description: Simple session HTTP cookies (with nothing else)

Cb.name: Known Device
Cb.description: Known device, such as those indicated through device posture or device management systems

Cc.name: Shared Secret
Cc.description: Shared secret, such as a username and password combination

Cd.name: Shared Key Proof
Cd.description: Cryptographic proof of key possession using shared key

Ce.name: Asymmetric Key Proof
Ce.description: Cryptographic proof of key possession using asymmetric key

Cf.name: Hardware Token
Cf.description: Sealed hardware token / keys stored in a trusted platform module

Ma.name: Self-Asserted Credentials
Ma.description: Self-asserted primary credentials (user chooses their own credentials and must rotate or revoke them manually) / no additional verification for primary credential issuance or rotation

Mb.name: Remote Issuance
Mb.description: Remote issuance and rotation / use of backup recovery credentials (such as email verification) / deletion on user request

Mc.name: Full Proofing Required
Mc.description: Full proofing required for each issuance and rotation / revocation on suspicious activity

Aa.name: No Protection
Aa.description: No protection / unsigned bearer identifier (such as an HTTP session cookie in a web browser)

Ab.name: User Agent Assertion
Ab.description: Signed and verifiable assertion, passed through the user agent (web browser)

Ac.name: Back Channel Assertion
Ac.description: Signed and verifiable assertion, passed through a back channel

Ad.name: Encrypted Assertion
Ad.description: Assertion encrypted to the RP's key
